body.para: RedHat comes with OpenSSH. - You will need to install openssl* first, and then you can install openssh*. - Use whatever tool is customary to get sshd running full-time on each machine. - On each machine, as yourself, run "ssh-keygen". - Add the identity.pub on machine A to the ~/.ssh/authorized_keys on machine B, and vice-versa.
On Sun, May 14, 2000 at 06:36:00PM +0800, Mark Lo wrote:

quote.quotepara: Where can I find a ssh program for secure remote login. Does it ship with Redhat, if yes..how to enable the ssh functions.
